text.div:
SHR AnatomicalDirectionCS CodeSystem

Anatomical location or specimen further detailing directionality. Codes are from NCI

name: AnatomicalDirectionCS
title: SHR AnatomicalDirectionCS CodeSystem
publisher: The MITRE Corporation: Standard Health Record Collaborative
description: Anatomical location or specimen further detailing directionality. Codes are from NCI

concept.display: ANTERIOR Denoting the front portion of the body or a structure.
concept.definition: ANTERIOR Denoting the front portion of the body or a structure.

concept.display: APICAL Relating to or located at the apex.
concept.definition: APICAL Relating to or located at the apex.

concept.display: BASAL Relating to or located at the lowest portion of a structure.
concept.definition: BASAL Relating to or located at the lowest portion of a structure.

concept.display: CAUDAL Toward the tail in a body.
concept.definition: CAUDAL Toward the tail in a body.

concept.display: CENTRAL A point or area that is approximately central within some larger region or structure.
concept.definition: CENTRAL A point or area that is approximately central within some larger region or structure.

concept.display: CRANIAL Toward the head in a body.
concept.definition: CRANIAL Toward the head in a body.

concept.display: DEEP Extending relatively far inward.
concept.definition: DEEP Extending relatively far inward.

concept.display: DISTAL Situated farthest from a point of reference.
concept.definition: DISTAL Situated farthest from a point of reference.

concept.display: DORSAL Pertaining to the back or upper surface of the body.
concept.definition: DORSAL Pertaining to the back or upper surface of the body.

concept.display: DORSOLATERAL Toward the back and side of a body.
concept.definition: DORSOLATERAL Toward the back and side of a body.

concept.display: FORE Of or involving the front of a main body.
concept.definition: FORE Of or involving the front of a main body.

concept.display: HIND Of or involving the back of a main body.
concept.definition: HIND Of or involving the back of a main body.

concept.display: INFERIOR Pertaining to a point below a given reference point.
concept.definition: INFERIOR Pertaining to a point below a given reference point.

concept.display: INNER Inside or closer to the inside of the body or object.
concept.definition: INNER Inside or closer to the inside of the body or object.

concept.display: INTERMEDIATE Located between two points or extremes.
concept.definition: INTERMEDIATE Located between two points or extremes.

concept.display: LOWER The bottom one of two.
concept.definition: LOWER The bottom one of two.

concept.display: MEDIAL Toward the middle or in a limb toward the median plane.
concept.definition: MEDIAL Toward the middle or in a limb toward the median plane.

concept.display: MIDLINE A medial line, especially the medial line or medial plane of the body (or some part of the body).
concept.definition: MIDLINE A medial line, especially the medial line or medial plane of the body (or some part of the body).

concept.display: NASAL Of, or related to, or in the direction of the nose.
concept.definition: NASAL Of, or related to, or in the direction of the nose.

concept.display: OUTER Being on or toward the outside of the body or object.
concept.definition: OUTER Being on or toward the outside of the body or object.

concept.display: PERIPHERAL On or near an edge or constituting an outer boundary;the outer area.
concept.definition: PERIPHERAL On or near an edge or constituting an outer boundary;the outer area.

concept.display: POSTERIOR Denoting the back portion of the body or a structure.
concept.definition: POSTERIOR Denoting the back portion of the body or a structure.

concept.display: ROSTRAL Toward the muzzle in the head.
concept.definition: ROSTRAL Toward the muzzle in the head.

concept.display: SUPERFICIAL Of or pertaining to the exterior surface.
concept.definition: SUPERFICIAL Of or pertaining to the exterior surface.

concept.display: SUPERIOR Pertaining to a point above a given reference point.
concept.definition: SUPERIOR Pertaining to a point above a given reference point.

concept.display: SURFACE The extended two-dimensional outer layer or area of a three-dimensional object.
concept.definition: SURFACE The extended two-dimensional outer layer or area of a three-dimensional object.

concept.display: TEMPORAL Of, or related to, anatomic sites that are located in the cranium, brain, and eye.
concept.definition: TEMPORAL Of, or related to, anatomic sites that are located in the cranium, brain, and eye.

concept.display: TIP The pointed end of a structure.
concept.definition: TIP The pointed end of a structure.

concept.display: UPPER The top one of two.
concept.definition: UPPER The top one of two.

concept.display: VENTRAL Pertaining to the front or lower surface of the body.
concept.definition: VENTRAL Pertaining to the front or lower surface of the body.

concept.display: VENTROLATERAL Of or pertaining to the front and side of a main body.
concept.definition: VENTROLATERAL Of or pertaining to the front and side of a main body.
